simple.gui
Class WizardFrame

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Dialog
                  javax.swing.JDialog
                      simple.gui.WizardFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class WizardFrame
extends javax.swing.JDialog
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

This is a JDialog frame that is used in combination with WizardPanel to create a step-by-step wizard.
What the frame looks like:

 ___________________________
 ||                       ||
 ||                       ||   << main panel
 ||                       ||
 ||_______________________||
 ||_____[<< Back][Next >>]||   << bottom panel
The WizardPanels decide if Back or Next is enabled.
Created: 2005

Author:
Kenneth Pierce
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

WizardFrame

public WizardFrame(javax.swing.JFrame frame,
                   java.lang.String title,
                   boolean modal)
Creates a blank wizard with the next and back buttons displayed and a default size of 600x500.

Parameters:
frame -
title -
modal - If true, blocks until window is closed and disallows the parent frame from taking focus.
